title: Jerusalem font
content:
Any help would be appreciated

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [picture 2014-04-17 at 4.14.45 PM.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831064038/http:/typophile.com/files/picture%202014-04-17%20at%204.14.45%20PM.jpg) | 45.06 KB |
author: darksympho

comments.content:
You can use **[Asphodel](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831064038/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Scriptorium-Fonts&ffam=Asphodel%20-%20Regular&fid=aa2c7fcb0f5a90d481bf3fd0a550230f&fsize=60&text=Jerusalem&fit=1)** by David F. Nalle [1995, Scriptorium Fonts]  
although there is also a font called **Ferdinand** digitized by Dan X. Solo. [1998, Dover Publications] which looks like much better quality to me

This a squeezed version of a typeface cut by Herman Ihlenburg in 1892 and sold by MacKellar Smiths and Jordan as Ferdinand. If you want a fairly good quality digital version it's included in the book by Dan X. Solo, \_24 Victorian Display Fonts - CD-Rom and Book\_ (Dover Electronic Display Fonts S.) Google didn't produce a link to the U.S. Amazon. Here is the U.K, Amazon [http://www.amazon.co.uk/24-Victorian-Display-Fonts-Electronic/dp/0486999564](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831064038/http:/www.amazon.co.uk/24-Victorian-Display-Fonts-Electronic/dp/0486999564 "http://www.amazon.co.uk/24-Victorian-Display-Fonts-Electronic/dp/0486999564") Google also suggested some other U.S. sellers.  
Don
